reviewText: Because this workout is designed to be done only twice a week, it is easy to stay motivated and to keep up a routine.  Kathy explains the function of each muscle group in the upper body, as well as details how the exercises will affect the muscles.  Because of the explanations, it is easy to master the form of each exercise, and when you're strengthened enough to zip through each set with ease, you get heavier weights, and it's like a whole new tape again.  So far in the two months that I've been using this workout, I have seen improvement in my upper-body strength.  The ab and lower-back section of this tape still provides ample challenge for now (especially those HFL Leg Thrusts).  What drives me to recommend this video is that before I came across this video, I was a closet couch potato.  I'd do an exercise tape semi-faithfully for three weeks at the most, then get bored with it because I wasn't feeling or seeing results.  The "Secrets of a Great Body" workouts do not give instant results, but you will start feeling stronger during the first few weeks of your routine, and when you can do all twelve push-ups in both sets, you feel like you're getting somewhere. Get this video and let this Secret out!
Title: N/A

reviewText: In this tape, Kathy Smith has put together a strong workout for each of the major muscle groups in the entire upper body.  After a short (4 minutes) warm up, Kathy goes through the muscle groups one-by-one, staring with chest, moving on to triceps, shoulders, and back, and finishing with biceps for a total of 21 minutes.  Next comes a fast-moving 6-minute ab workout consisting of just a few moves for the abs and back, and finally, the tape ends with a 2-minute cool down.Although the exercises in this video are pretty standard, Kathy adds some unique twists; for example, doing front shoulder raises at a slight side angle was something I'd never seen before.  In addition, Kathy's excellent pointers on form ensure that you will really focus on working the muscle--her tip not to let the arms move forward on french presses made me feel the exercise in my triceps like I never have before!  Using both voiceovers and live remarks, Kathy provides perfect cuing and gentle encouragement.Some of the prior criticisms of this workout are warranted; namely, that the instructional portions inbetween the moves interfere with the flow of the workout and that some of the transitions happen too quickly.  However, I found these flaws to be minor, particularly given that the educational information was brief and provided not only helpful refreshers but also a welcome break after some tough moves!  Also, it was easy enough for me to pause the tape here and there if I missed the first repetition or two.Kathy is a great instructor who is warm and friendly while remaining serious about the workout.  She is shown here with four helpers, three women and one man, who serve as models on form.  The studio is sparse, and the music is light and non-distracting.  This workout is perfect for beginners (using light weights) wanting to learn correct techniques as well as intermediates (using heavier weights) looking for refreshers on form.
summary: Very good workout for your entire upper body
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love the workout, but don't care too much for the video, so I gave Secrets of a Great Upper Body "only" four stars. But allow me to say it's a GREAT strength-building routine that you will get A LOT out of if you listen to Kathy Smith's instructions and really focus in on the individual muscles you're working.Oh, the video. Other reviewers have mentioned it: the brief anatomy lessons before each muscle group & short demonstrations of each exercise before the reps start. Clearly a misguided editing decision, but not a big deal overall. Keep the remote handy, or better yet, do what I've done and abandon the tape altogether once you get the routine down. It'll shorten your workout time, and also let you maximize your efforts by allowing you to follow YOUR OWN PACE, as opposed to trying to follow along with the tape.I wrote down the different exercises, and what weights I use for each. The first set I usually make lighter than the second set by a few pounds, so that the second set I'm really pushing to the point of fatigue. I aim for each rep to take 2 seconds to contract and two seconds to release, and instead of watching Kathy & her spandexed peeps when I workout, I've found it's much more helpful to keep an eye on my own form in a full-length mirror. Using this method, I've been VERY happy with the workout Kathy Smith put together for this tape! Talk about results!!For a year beforehand I worked out with weights, but always by following along with a video (Arms of Steel, and also Kathy's Lift Weights to Lose Weight). This tape, however, is so straight-forward --just ten basic moves, two with an additional variation -- that after a couple of weeks I felt comfortable with just my "cheat sheet" list of exercises to guide me. Since I no longer need to keep up with the tape, I can really work at "eeking out" those last few reps, allowing me to use heavier weights, which has really increased my strength and also my motivation!Whether you do the tape or just the workout, you'll soon appreciate the many benefits of this fine strength-training routine that Kathy Smith has put together for this video. Enjoy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like this execise video a lot. It concentrates on sculpting your upper body, which is a step beyond toning. And it is very easy to follow, the exercises are very easy to memorize, and Kathy is a great motivator. If you want aerobics as well as a strength workout like this, what I have found beneficial is doing Kathy Smith's "March to Fitness" tape, which is 30 mins of low impact exercise, and then doing this tape, and alternating days with her "Lower Body Workout" which is the companion tape to this one. In this way, I find I get the best of both world's, and the results show a lot faster. But however you choose to do it, this is a great program.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The workout in this video is decent... And I love kathy Smith.... BUT there seems to be alot of wasted time in this workout. She stops the exercises to do a little anatomy lesson, to show you where the muscle is, blah blah blah. While these lessons are a nice thing to add, it becomes bothersome to have to go through everytime you do the video. It would be better to have this at the END or even the begining. The biggest problem with this video is poor editing.  Sometimes between exercises the camera just cuts to a new one. (When Kathy and the others are switching sides, or changing position) The camera doesn't follow the people, so you aren't left with enough time to change position as well. I also didn't give this a higher rating because it is a little too easy for what is made to seem like an intermediate /advanced workout. This may just be because I am in good shape... While the actual exercises are good and the workout is well balanced for the upper body, there could be a few more exercises for some body parts, the ab workout is especially wimpy. I would recommend Kathy's Lift Weights to Lose Weight video instead, as it the time will fly and it is much easier to tailor the workout to meet your needs when you advanced in fitness levels.
Title: N/A
